intro: Astragalus amphioxys var. typicus, commonly known as the narrowleaf milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and features slender, often hairy stems. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several narrow, lance-shaped leaflets. The species is adapted to dry conditions and is often found in sandy or gravelly soils.
